dsDescriptionValue.value: Soft X-ray and magnetic field observations of the Sun (quiet Sun, X-ray bright points, active regions, and integrated solar disk) and active stars (dwarf and pre–main-sequence) that were used in Figure 1 in Pevtsov et al (2003) in their study of X-ray spectral radiance LX vs. total unsigned magnetic flux for solar and stellar objects.

keywordValue.value: stars: coronae — stars: magnetic fields — Sun: corona — Sun: magnetic fields

publicationCitation.value: Pevtsov, A. A., Fisher, G. H., Acton, L. W., Longcope, D. W., Johns-Krull, C. M., Kankelborg, C. C., and Metcalf, T. R. : 2003, "The Relationship Between X-ray Radiance and Magnetic Flux", Astrophys. Journal, 598 (2), 1387-1391, DOI: 10.1086/378944

fields.value: This dataset was used for Figure 1 in Pevtsov, A. A., Fisher, G. H., Acton, L. W., Longcope, D. W., Johns-Krull, C. M., Kankelborg, C. C., and Metcalf, T. R. : 2003, "The Relationship Between X-ray Radiance and Magnetic Flux", Astrophys. Journal, 598 (2), 1387-1391

files.description: There are 6 subsets of data corresponding to different solar and stellar objects. For each subset, first line gives the number of datapoints followed by (magnetic flux and X-ray radiance) entries in the following format (e14.7,2x,e14.7). Magnetic flux is in units of Maxwell, and X-ray radiance is in erg per sec.
files.label: lx_mflux_data4plot.txt

dataFile.description: There are 6 subsets of data corresponding to different solar and stellar objects. For each subset, first line gives the number of datapoints followed by (magnetic flux and X-ray radiance) entries in the following format (e14.7,2x,e14.7). Magnetic flux is in units of Maxwell, and X-ray radiance is in erg per sec.
